metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7414 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The ZIP signature-verification feature in PHP before 5.6.26 and 7.x before 7.0.11 does not ensure that the uncompressed_filesize field is large enough, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds memory access) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted PHAR archive, related to ext/phar/util.c and ext/phar/zip.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7414` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.20
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.20
libphp5-embed - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.20
php-pear - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.20
php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.20
php5-cgi - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.20
php5-cli - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.20
php5-common - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.20
php5-curl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.20
php5-enchant - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.20
php5-fpm - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.20

php5-odbc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.20
php5-pgsql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.20

No subscription required

criterions.comment: php5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.20').
